trans-unit.source: Stores the value of a <xref href="System.Decimal"></xref> constant in metadata.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use this attribute to specify at compile time that a decimal value is a constant value.
You can apply this attribute to fields or parameters.
For more information about constant attributes, see the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CustomConstantAttribute> class.
The classes in <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices> are for compiler writers use only.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute"></xref> class with the specified signed integer values.
The power of 10 scaling factor that indicates the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.
Valid values are 0 through 28 inclusive.
A value of 0 indicates a positive value, and a value of 1 indicates a negative value.
The high 32 bits of the 96-bit <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute.Value"></xref>.
The middle 32 bits of the 96-bit <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute.Value"></xref>.
The low 32 bits of the 96-bit <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute.Value"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute"></xref> class with the specified unsigned integer values.
The power of 10 scaling factor that indicates the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.
Valid values are 0 through 28 inclusive.
A value of 0 indicates a positive value, and a value of 1 indicates a negative value.
The high 32 bits of the 96-bit <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute.Value"></xref>.
The middle 32 bits of the 96-bit <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute.Value"></xref>.
The low 32 bits of the 96-bit <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DecimalConstantAttribute.Value"></xref>.
Gets the decimal constant stored in this attribute.
The decimal constant stored in this attribute.
